description: Tool to decipher messages in iokharic language (a kind of dragon language with claw symbols) used by dragons, for example in Dungeons and Dragons.

questions.answer: The iokharic language uses an alphabet of 36 characters to represent the 26 letters of the alphabet and the 10 digits (from 0 to 9). The encryption/translation phase is therefore a substitution of the characters with the corresponding iokharic symbols. questions.question: How to encrypt using iokharic language?

questions.answer: Deciphering/translating iokharic scripts consists in substituting each character by the corresponding Latin alphabet letter (or digit). However, the iokharic language also uses a word dictionary of its own, so the resulting text may not be intelligible. Example:  is translated by DRAGON
questions.question: How to decrypt iokharic cipher?

questions.answer: The message is composed of symbols recalling the claws of a dragon, with mainly 1 to 3 vertical and horizontal lines. The iokharic language is not the only alphabet given to the dragons, like Draconic or Amharic, all are sometimes used in role playing games like dungeons and dragons (D&D).
